basically im trying to rip a lot of my anime dvds and they way they are actually written on the dvd i need to edit the video, and i always rip the original mpeg2 and render that down for the best quality. and the Able mpeg Editor does it the fastest and with the best quality as it dosnt de-code the original file so its really nice. 

either way thanks again this DL does work great but not exactly what i was looking for, lemme know about the other program whenever you can ;P

AVG found two trojans be aware !!

all you hafta do is:

1) Extract files
2) Install program 
3) copy the contents in the cracked folder to your hard drive in the respectable folders 
4) to get here go to "start menu" 
5) now click "computer"
6) double click ur hard drive "local disc (C:)"
7) now double click "Program Files"
8) Look for "AVS4YOU" folder and double click
9) there will be a folder named: AVSVideoRecorder and AVSVideoEditor; copy and replace with the crack folder contents found in the downloads folder.
10) Voila!

RH Explain why Kaspersky steel crack as quick as I downlod program and say it's trojan horse win 32 vilsel ufu.
The Crack in this file is not for the video editor...
Guys, it's a Trojan. I just went to unzip the file, and McAfee picked it up.

Kaspersky returns that the crack is a trojan -- This is a false positive gents, I unfortunately haven't found a way to get Kaspersky not to recognize it as a trojan, so I had to install it onto my laptop.

Note for the apparently unwise: Of course cracks will be seen as malware, because technically they are. They alter software, which is the definition of malware.

Hey RobbingHood i have to ask u smthng.

Can u tell me which softwares do good rippers use like secretmyth vision etc to work on movies because i tried one and i was left with the movie size of 17.6gb.

And thanx for all the uploads.

@captainchao999 

Usually always uninstall a previous version before installing a new version. Cracks usually are version specific and won't work for another version.

Important note:
*************

Recently Kaspersky detects AVSVideoEditor.exe as Win32.Vilsel.okt (Trojan) and AVSVideoRecorder.exe as 
Win32.Vilsel.ofu (Trojan). Probably some signatures of a known virus are added to Kaspersky's virus definitions 
database which contain some of the same signatures used for the cracked files. However, the cracked files are 
100% clean, and the detection(s) by Kaspersky (and McAfee) are just false positives.
